comments:
It seems that any sort of scrapbook evaluation involving user code fails to run 
in the scrapbook.  An eval like: System.out.println(new java.util.Date())
works fine, but something like: new foo.bar.Foobar().foo() fails with
the following walkback:

java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: foo/bar/Foobar
	at CodeSnippet_8.run(CodeSnippet_8.java:3)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.snippeteditor.ScrapbookMain1.eval
(ScrapbookMain1.java:9)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Native Method)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.snippeteditor.ScrapbookMain.evalLoop
(ScrapbookMain.java:46)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.snippeteditor.ScrapbookMain.main
(ScrapbookMain.java:27)
in the console.

If you try to set the 'run in package' to "foo.bar", then try:
new Foobar().foo()
you get: Foobar cannot be resolved or is not a type
in the scrapbook.
I think this is a dupliate of bug# 1753
